properties.media:imagetext:
FLYING FACTS
Did you know that:
In 1927 Pan Am made its first passenger flight. On October 28 of that year we flew 90 miles
from Key West, Florida, to Havana, Cuba. The 1 hour and 20 minute flight replaced an 8
hour bumpy boat ride.
• In 1935 Pan Am flew from San Francisco to Manila in 60 hours. This was the first commercial
air crossing of the Pacific Ocean.
• In 1939 Pan Am's "Yankee Clipper" made the first passenger aircraft transatlantic flight.
• In 1942 Pan Am made its first round-the-world flight. Today we can make these flights in
less than 2 days - quite a bit shorter than Jules Verne's balloon trip in "Around the World
in 80 Days"!
• In 1962 Pan Am completed its 100,000th transatlantic flight.
• On January 21, 1970, Pan Am flew the first scheduled 747 passenger flight from New York
to London.
• This year Pan Am will carry over 12 million passengers across some 90,000 miles of routes
that touch 6 continents.
• Pan Am employs over 30,000 people. This may be more people than live in your town.
• Pan Am is truly the "World's Most Experienced Airline
THE WORLD IS R
UND
Pan Am uses Great Circle routes to fly you to
your destination. You can get an idea of how
this works when you get home. On a globe take
a piece of string and stretch it between your
departure city and your arrival city, then move
the string over the surface until you
get the smallest amount of string
between
the two cities.
This
TOKYO h
will happen when the string
rests towards the nearest
pole
(North
pole
or
South pole).
EW YORK
AIR ROUTE (GREAT GIA
SAN FRANCISCO
COMPASS DIRECTION
You now have the Great Circle route
and
the shortest
distance
between
your
cities.
When this
same line is
shown on a wall (Mercator) map,
looks like a big curve and the longest
distance.
But now
you
know it isn't
because the world IS round!
2012.149.0720 b

FLYING FACTS
Did you know that:
In 1927 Pan Am made its first passenger flight. On October 28 of that year we flew 90 miles

• In 1935 Pan Am flew from San Francisco to Manila in 60 hours. This was the first commercial
air crossing of the Pacific Ocean.
• In 1939 Pan Am's "Yankee Clipper" made the first passenger aircraft transatlantic flight.
• In 1942 Pan Am made its first round-the-world flight. Today we can make these flights in
less than 2 days - quite a bit shorter than Jules Verne's balloon trip in "Around the World
in 80 Days"!
• In 1962 Pan Am completed its 100,000th transatlantic flight.
• On January 21, 1970, Pan Am flew the first scheduled 747 passenger flight from New York
to London.
• This year Pan Am will carry over 12 million passengers across some 90,000 miles of routes
that touch 6 continents.
• Pan Am employs over 30,000 people. This may be more people than live in your town.
• Pan Am is truly the "World's Most Experienced Airline

enjoy seeing one of Pan Am's historic
Clippers.
This was the Sikorsky S-40.
